criteria: Accuracy of Identification and Mapping of Battles/Campaigns
Understanding of Roles of American and British Leaders
descriptions: No battles or campaigns are identified or mapped.
One or two major battles/campaigns are identified, but the mapping is inaccurate or missing.
Several major battles/campaigns are identified with some inaccuracies in mapping or details.
Most major battles/campaigns are accurately identified and mapped, with minor omissions or inaccuracies.
All major battles/campaigns are accurately identified and mapped with a high level of detail.
All major battles/campaigns are comprehensively and accurately identified and mapped, demonstrating a deep understanding of their geographical context and strategic importance.
No American or British leaders are identified.
One or two leaders are mentioned, but their roles are not explained or are inaccurate.
Several leaders are identified, but their roles are vaguely described or have inaccuracies.
Most major American and British leaders are identified, and their roles are generally accurate.
All major American and British leaders are accurately identified, and their roles are well-explained with supporting details.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the roles of American and British leaders, including their motivations, strategies, and impact on the war.
No Indian leaders or alliances are mentioned.
Indian leaders are mentioned, but the alliances are not identified.
Some Indian leaders and their alliances are identified with limited accuracy.
Most major Indian leaders and their alliances on both sides are identified with reasonable accuracy.
All major Indian leaders and their alliances are accurately identified and the impact of those alliances are explained.
Demonstrates a deep understanding of the complex relationships between Indian nations, the American colonists, and the British, explaining the motivations and consequences of their alliances.
